medical_history.chief_complaint: Severe respiratory insufficiency due to COVID-19 requiring mechanical ventilation.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patients experienced symptom onset that progressed to respiratory insufficiency necessitating ICU admission. Symptoms began approximately 3 to 11 days before hospitalization, with significant respiratory distress leading to intubation and mechanical ventilation. One patient developed a left-sided pneumothorax 20 days post-admission.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Chronic nonallergic rhinosinusitis in one patient; otherwise, no relevant medical history specified for others.
medical_history.family_history: Family members had mild to moderate respiratory symptoms; one brother with COVID-19 did not survive, while another tested positive.
